Violation_Type: Misapplication of legal standard in refugee assessment
Legal_Issue: Whether the immigration officer applied the correct legal standard for assessing well-founded fear of persecution
Application_Facts: Ms. Sakthivel's refugee application was denied based on incorrect legal standard
Court_Ruling: The use of 'reasonable grounds' instead of 'serious possibility' constitutes an error warranting judicial review
Defendant_Behavior: Immigration officer used incorrect legal standard ('reasonable grounds')
Legal_Standard: Well-founded fear of persecution defined as 'serious possibility' or 'reasonable possibility'
Assessment_Factor: Nature and credibility of fear of persecution
Applicable_Legislation: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, subsection 72(1)
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review process initiated due to legal error
Legal_Provision_Cited: Subsection 72(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Relief_Sought: Allowance of judicial review and remittal for re-determination
Governing_Rule: Supreme Court and Federal Court of Appeal precedents on 'serious possibility' test
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to apply correct legal standard in evaluating evidence
Outcome: Case remanded for re-determination by a different immigration officer
Decisional_Body: Immigration officer, reviewed by Federal Court
Harm_Assessment: Risk of persecution if returned to country of origin
Cause_Description: Denial of refugee status due to misapplication of legal standard for assessing fear of persecution
Evidence_Handling: Incorrect evaluation of applicant's claim due to wrong legal test
Legal_Provision_Violated: Proper interpretation of well-founded fear under IRPA
Decision_Rationale: Use of 'reasonable grounds' instead of 'serious possibility' is a material legal error
Decision_Making_Body: Immigration Officer, subject to Federal Court judicial review
Evidentiary_Issues: Legal standard misapplied in assessment of evidence
Legal_Standard_Applied: 'Reasonable grounds' (incorrectly used); correct standard is 'serious possibility']
